events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred on a busy street, causing significant vehicle damage.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after review of the details mentioning a vehicle collision.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the auto accident claim and coordinate next steps.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer, confirming receipt of the accident report.
Additional documents including police report and repair estimates were requested from the customer.
The customer submitted all required documents, including accident photos and vehicle repair quotes.
An investigation was initiated to verify the details of the car collision as described by the insured.
The investigation verified all submitted details and confirmed the vehicle damage assessment was accurate.
A settlement offer based on estimated repair costs was proposed and sent to the insured for review.
The insured responded with acceptance of the proposed settlement offer for their vehicle repair.
The auto accident claim was formally approved following confirmation of payment terms and settlement.
The payment for vehicle repairs was issued promptly to the insured as part of the claim settlement.
The claim file was closed after successful payment and confirmation from the customer regarding repair completion.
All relevant documents and communications for the claim were archived according to company policies.
